pr_title: Fix resume mode to work correctly when group retry happened

timeline.message: Fix resume mode to work correctly when group retry happened
Add test cases for group retry

timeline.bodyText:
Project name and workflow name and command are all same name "retry" ?
It ma be a bit confused for me.
timeline.author: yoyama

replies.bodyText: I agree with you.. sorry for confusing, let me update project and workflow name.
replies.author: szyn

timeline.bodyText: May I ask you the purpose to check "retry_count" ?
timeline.author: yoyama
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -302,7 +302,16 @@ public Response startAttempt(RestSessionAttemptRequest request)
                 .getSessionStore(getSiteId())
                 .getTasksOfAttempt(attemptId);
 
+        List<Long> groupRetryErrorTaskIds = tasks.stream()
+                .filter(task -> task.getState() == TaskStateCode.GROUP_ERROR && task.getStateParams().has("retry_count"))

replies.bodyText:
Yes, it's to determine if a group retry has occurred or not.
Whenever a group retry occurs, there is a retry_count in stateParams.
replies.author: szyn

replies.bodyText: Got it. Thanks for your explanation.
replies.author: yoyama

replies.bodyText: Using retry_count as the switch of group retry seems a bit weird to me (Sorry if we've already discussed it. I may have had a wrong idea) since I thought retry_count is a just retry count for unexpected failures not like affecting the graph of tasks.
replies.author: komamitsu

timeline.bodyText: May I ask you the reason you choose first one ?
timeline.author: yoyama
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -344,7 +353,11 @@ private ArchivedTask matchTaskPattern(String pattern, List<ArchivedTask> tasks)
                     tasks
                             .stream()
                             .collect(
-                                    Collectors.toMap(t -> t.getFullName(), t -> t)
+                                    // Avoid 500 error due to duplicate key ArchivedTask
+                                    // if a group retry happened, IllegalStateException will be thrown
+                                    // because there are multiple tasks of the same name.
+                                    // Take the first one to make sure it is appropriately resumed.
+                                    Collectors.toMap(t -> t.getFullName(), t -> t, (a, b) -> a)

replies.bodyText: There is no specific reason. Either is fine because of the same name.
replies.author: szyn

replies.bodyText: Ah you need only the name. Got it. Thanks!
replies.author: yoyama

timeline.message: Add some test cases for group retry
Add filter to exclude dynamically generated tasks from successTasks

timeline.author: yoyama

replies.author: szyn

replies.bodyText: So resume failed tasks or something is clearer?
replies.author: komamitsu

timeline.bodyText: ditto. it seems you may expect to succeed.
timeline.author: yoyama

timeline.bodyText: I am not sure that this is really expected behavior or not.
timeline.author: yoyama
yoyama

timeline.bodyText:
// Need to filter the status of the task with "group_error" and "retry_count" in stateParams.


This might be a silly question... but what does it mean if the group error task has no retry_count?
timeline.author: komamitsu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -302,7 +302,19 @@ public Response startAttempt(RestSessionAttemptRequest request)
                 .getSessionStore(getSiteId())
                 .getTasksOfAttempt(attemptId);
 
+        // Collect tasksIds in which a group retry occurred.
+        // Need to filter the status of the task with "group_error" and "retry_count" in stateParams.

replies.bodyText: It means that group error has occurred, but no group retry has occurred. I added the same description to the codebase :)
replies.author: szyn

timeline.message: Add comments about group_error task has no retry_count
Update description of the resume options
Add a note in case a group-level retry is set up when resuming

timeline.bodyText: This validation should be removed since the above new code already filters tasks with the same condition?
timeline.author: komamitsu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -302,7 +302,19 @@ public Response startAttempt(RestSessionAttemptRequest request)
                 .getSessionStore(getSiteId())
                 .getTasksOfAttempt(attemptId);
 
+        // Collect tasksIds in which a group retry occurred.
+        // Need to filter the status of the task with "group_error" and "retry_count" in stateParams.
+        List<Long> groupRetryErrorTaskIds = tasks.stream()
+                .filter(task -> task.getState() == TaskStateCode.GROUP_ERROR && task.getStateParams().has("retry_count"))
+                .map(task -> task.getId())
+                .collect(Collectors.toList());
+
         List<Long> successTasks = tasks.stream()
+                // If a group error has occurred,
+                // exclude the group's child/dynamically generated tasks from successTasks
+                // even if they are in SUCCESS state
+                .filter(task -> task.getParentId().isPresent() && !groupRetryErrorTaskIds.contains(task.getParentId().get()))
+                .filter(task -> !task.getFullName().contains("^sub"))
                 .filter(task -> task.getState() == TaskStateCode.SUCCESS)
                 .map(task -> {
                     if (!task.getParentId().isPresent()) {

replies.bodyText: The above filter will only exclude child tasks with a group error at the parent, I suspect this validation cannot be removed.
replies.author: szyn

timeline.bodyText: duplicated key of ArchivedTask is a bit better?

                     tasks
                             .stream()
                             .collect(
-                                    Collectors.toMap(t -> t.getFullName(), t -> t)
+                                    // Avoid 500 error due to duplicate key ArchivedTask

replies.bodyText: When are duplicated key tasks generated?

timeline.message: Add test cases that do not contain _retry on group
Update description of the resume options for nested groups
